contentrichtext.text: {{Taxobox | image = Ficedula_parva.jpg | status = LC | status_system = IUCN3.1 | status_ref = <ref name=IUCN2012>{{IUCN|id=160032239 |title=''Ficedula albicilla'' |assessors=[[BirdLife International]] |version=2012.1 |year=2012 |accessdate=16 July 2012}}</ref> | regnum = [[Animalia]] | phylum = [[Chordata]] | classis = [[Aves]] | ordo = [[Passeriformes]] | familia = [[Muscicapidae]] | genus = ''[[Ficedula]]'' | species = '''''F. albicilla''''' | binomial = ''Ficedula albicilla'' | binomial_authority = ([[Peter Simon Pallas|Pallas]], 1811) | synonyms = ''Ficedula parva albicilla'' }} [[File:Red-throated Flycatcher (Ficedula parva) at Sindhrot near Vadodara, Gujrat Pix 112.jpg|thumb|left| at [[Sindhrot]] in [[Vadodara]] District of [[Gujarat]], [[India]]. ]] The '''Taiga Flycatcher''' or '''Red-throated Flycatcher''' (''Ficedula albicilla'') is a species of [[bird]] in the [[Muscicapidae]] family. It is found in the [[Indian Subcontinent]] and [[Southeast Asia]], ranging across [[Tajikistan]], [[Kazakhstan]], [[Uzbekistan]], [[Bangladesh]], [[Bhutan]], [[India]], [[Cambodia]], [[Laos]], [[Myanmar]], [[Nepal]], [[Malaysia]], [[Thailand]], [[Mongolia]], [[China]], [[Vietnam]], and [[Japan]]. Its natural [[habitat]] is subtropical or tropical moist [[montane forest]]s. It is sometimes considered a subspecies of the [[Red-breasted Flycatcher]]. ==References== {{reflist}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Taiga Flycatcher}} [[Category:Ficedula]] [[Category:Birds of Nepal]] [[Category:Birds of Bangladesh]]
